title: Graph Neural Networks for Crystal Structure Prediction
abstract: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have shown remarkable success in predicting crystal structures and properties. We develop a novel GNN architecture that achieves state-of-the-art performance on multiple benchmark datasets for crystal structure prediction.

title: Materials informatics: A review of AI and machine learning tools, platforms, data repositories, and applications to architectured porous materials
abstract: Comprehensive review of AI and machine learning tools in materials science, emphasizing applications for experimental researchers. Covers platforms, data repositories, and applications to porous materials with educational focus.

title: Recent progress on machine learning with limited materials data: Using tools from data science and domain knowledge
abstract: Review of machine learning with limited materials data, covering data augmentation, feature engineering, active learning with uncertainty quantification, and transfer learning approaches.

title: Examining graph neural networks for crystal structures: Limitations and opportunities for capturing periodicity
abstract: Critical examination of GNN limitations in capturing periodicity of crystal structures. Identifies fundamental challenges and proposes directions for improvement.

title: A review on the applications of graph neural networks in materials science at the atomic scale
abstract: Comprehensive review of GNN applications at atomic scale. Covers CGCNN, iCGCNN, ALIGNN, MEGNet, GATGNN, and other key models with detailed comparisons.

title: A geometric-information-enhanced crystal graph network for predicting properties of materials
abstract: Proposes Geo-CGCNN incorporating bond angles and directional information. Achieves 25.6-35.7% improvement for formation energy and 12.4-27.6% for band gap predictions.

title: Enhancing material property prediction with ensemble deep graph convolutional networks
abstract: Demonstrates effectiveness of ensemble learning with multiple GNN models (CGCNN, MT-CGCNN, ALIGNN, MEGNet) for improved prediction accuracy and uncertainty quantification.

title: Rapid discovery of promising materials via active learning with multi-objective optimization
abstract: Active learning with multi-objective Bayesian optimization finds optimal Pareto fronts by sampling only 16-23% of search space using EHVI.

title: Multi-objective materials bayesian optimization with active learning of design constraints: Design of ductile refractory multi-principal-element alloys
abstract: Novel multi-information Bayesian optimization framework for MPEAs design, optimizing DFT-derived ductility indicators while learning manufacturing constraints.

title: Accelerating materials discovery with Bayesian optimization and graph deep learning
abstract: Combines Bayesian optimization with graph deep learning for DFT-free crystal structure relaxation. Successfully synthesizes and validates two new materials.

title: Machine Learning-Assisted Bayesian Optimization for the Discovery of Effective Additives for Dendrite Suppression in Lithium Metal Batteries
abstract: ML-assisted Bayesian optimization for efficient discovery of lithium metal battery additives. Combines experiments and simulations in active learning process.

title: Structure-aware graph neural network based deep transfer learning framework for enhanced predictive analytics on diverse materials datasets
abstract: Structure-aware GNN-based deep transfer learning framework using graph neural networks for improved predictions on small materials datasets.

title: Cross-property deep transfer learning framework for enhanced predictive analytics on small materials data
abstract: Cross-property deep transfer learning framework leveraging models trained on large datasets for different properties. Based on physical interrelations between properties.

title: Predicting Materials Properties with Little Data Using Shotgun Transfer Learning
abstract: Shotgun transfer learning approach integrating knowledge from multiple related tasks for property prediction with limited data.

title: Small data machine learning in materials science
abstract: Comprehensive review of small data machine learning challenges and solutions. Covers active learning, transfer learning, and physics-informed approaches.

title: Explainable machine learning in materials science
abstract: Systematic review of explainable AI in materials science. Covers LIME, SHAP, attention mechanisms, and physics-informed interpretability.

title: Explainable AI Techniques for Comprehensive Analysis of the Relationship between Process Parameters and Material Properties in FDM-Based 3D-Printed Biocomposites
abstract: Application of XAI techniques including LIME to analyze process-property relationships in 3D-printed biocomposites.

title: Methods, progresses, and opportunities of materials informatics
abstract: Comprehensive review of materials informatics methods, progress, and opportunities. Systematically organizes ML classifications, databases, and applications.
